intro: Tithymalus ibericus, commonly known as the Iberian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Tithymalus ibericus is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
